definition: to save from extinction/to save the nation
to save/to assist/to rescue
variant of 救[jiu4]
old variant of 亡[wang2]
to die/to lose/to be gone/to flee/deceased
Save the Nation anti-Japanese organization
pinyin: kang4 Ri4 jiu4 wang2 tuan2 ti3

definition: the Save the Nation Anti-Japanese Protest Movement stemming from the Manchurian railway incident of 18th July 1931 九一八事變|九一八事变
pinyin: Kang4 Ri4 Jiu4 wang2 Yun4 dong4

sentences.english: At the critical moment, he plunged himself into the anti-Japanese war.
sentences.chinese: 在民族危机时刻他奋起投入了抗日救亡运动。

sentences.english: Wu-Xu thoughts of "save the nation from extinction" and "enlightenment" promoted the trend of "history revolution".
sentences.chinese: 戊戌救亡启蒙思潮催动了“史学革命”潮流。

sentences.english: The new cultural movement was to aimed at the national salvation.
sentences.chinese: 民族救亡是新文化运动的目的。

sentences.english: The article holds that national salvation is the historical theme of modern China's patriotism.
sentences.chinese: 本文认为救亡图存是中国近代爱国主义的历史主题。

sentences.english: To salvage China from subjugation was an urgent mission for the Chinese nation.
sentences.chinese: 救亡图存的民族使命迫在眉睫。

definition: to save the nation
the Save the Nation Anti-Japanese Protest Movement stemming from the Manchurian railway incident of 18th July 1931 九一八事變|九一八事变
pinyin: Kang4 Ri4 Jiu4 wang2 Yun4 dong4

definition: anti-imperialist/anti-imperialists
war of resistance, especially the war against Japan (1937-1945)
to resist Japan (esp. during WW2)/anti-Japanese (esp. wartime activities)
democratic revolution/bourgeois revolution (in Marx-Leninist theory, a prelude to the proletarian revolution)
at stake/in peril
May Fourth Movement/Chinese national renewal movement that started with 4th May 1919 protest against the Treaty of Versailles
the New Culture Movement (mid-1910s and 1920s), intellectual revolution against Confucianism aiming to introduce Western elements, especially democracy and science
opposing Yuan Shikai 袁世凱|袁世凯 in War of national protection 1915-1916/same as 反袁鬥爭|反袁斗争
anti-imperialist movement of 30th May 1925, involving general strike esp. in Shanghai, Guangzhou, Hong Kong etc
United Front (either of the two alliances between the Guomindang and the Communist Party, 1923-1927 and 1937-1945)
Tongmenghui, Sun Yat-sen's alliance for democracy, founded 1905, became the Guomindang 國民黨|国民党 in 1912
anti-communist
abbr. for 五卅運動|五卅运动[wu3 sa4 yun4 dong4], The May Thirtieth Movement (1925)
(China's) War of Resistance against Japan (1937-1945)
